intro: Lachemilla tonduzii, commonly known as the Andean stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its compact rosettes of fleshy, silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, typically in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for alpine gardens. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, Lachemilla tonduzii is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a ground cover in arid environments.
